meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver someone in a scheme or plan.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outscheme her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outscheme the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was always trying to outscheme the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outscheme her rivals made her a formidable competitor.
meanings.sent5: In the game of wits, he always found a way to outscheme his opponents.

meanings.definition: To devise or plan something in a clever or cunning way.
meanings.sent1: He would often outscheme his friends in coming up with creative ideas.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to outscheme their competitors with a brilliant strategy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to outscheme its owner by hiding its toys in unexpected places.
meanings.sent4: She had a knack for outscheming any obstacles that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind criminal was always able to outscheme the authorities with elaborate plans.
